articles.title: How to create an account
articles.content: Click Sign Up on the homepage, fill in your details (name, email, phone, password), and verify your email. After verification you will be redirected to your dashboard if automatic sign-in is enabled.

articles.title: Taking your first RC test
articles.content: Open Test from the sidebar or dashboard, click Start New Test, read the passage, answer all questions, and click Submit. Attempt summaries typically appear within seconds in the Analysis page; if processing is delayed, check again in a minute.

articles.title: Understanding the dashboard
articles.content: The dashboard highlights key metrics such as attempts, short-term accuracy, reason coverage, topic distribution, and recent activity. Use these to track progress and identify areas for improvement.

articles.title: Navigating the platform
articles.content: Use the left sidebar to access features: Dashboard, Test, Attempts, Analysis, Archive, Insights, Profile, and Help. Search and sorting tools are available in relevant lists.

articles.title: Dashboard analytics explained
articles.content: The dashboard shows recent attempts, accuracy over time, topic distribution rings, and an activity graph. Metrics are updated in near real-time after each test.

articles.title: Using the Analysis page
articles.content: Analysis shows score, time, correct count, avg time per question, question-level breakdown, reason tagging, coverage meter, and category accuracy. Tag reasons for incorrect answers to track patterns.

articles.title: Archive & passage access
articles.content: Passage availability depends on your subscription. For example, access rules may allow visibility of passages you attempted and additional daily allocations for your subscription period. Search by topic or title, and sort results using the UI controls.

articles.title: Attempts & history
articles.content: Attempts list past runs with date, score, duration, topics, and quick stats. Click any row to view detailed analysis. Historical data is preserved when you change plans unless noted in account settings.

articles.title: Insights (Performance Studio)
articles.content: Performance Studio offers advanced analytics: overview metrics, question-type breakdown, progress timeline, radar charts, and CSV export. Some features require an active subscription.

articles.title: How scoring works
articles.content: Score = (Correct Answers / Total Questions) × 100. Each question has equal weight. Time does not change your raw score, though speed + accuracy may affect leaderboard placement.

articles.title: Understanding reason tags
articles.content: Reason tags help identify why an answer was incorrect: Misread, Missed detail, Wrong inference, Time pressure, Vocabulary gap. Tag incorrect answers to improve your error tracking.

articles.title: Coverage meter explained
articles.content: Coverage measures how many of your incorrect answers have been tagged with reasons. Coverage is calculated for incorrect answers only — higher coverage (for example, 80%+) means more actionable insights.

articles.title: Speed guidance
articles.content: Example speed tiers: Fast (<90s/question), Medium (90–120s), Slow (>120s). Your ideal pace balances speed and accuracy — tune targets based on practice goals.

articles.title: Category accuracy breakdown
articles.content: Category accuracy shows performance across question types (Inference, Detail, Main Idea, Author's Purpose, Vocabulary, etc.). Use this to focus practice on weak areas.

articles.title: Subscription plans
articles.content: {{platformName}} offers Free and Premium plans. Free: basic analytics and limited daily access; Premium: extended access, Performance Studio, advanced insights, and priority support. See Subscriptions for exact benefits for each plan.

articles.title: Payment methods
articles.content: We accept major cards, UPI, and net banking via our payment provider. Payments are processed securely; you'll receive an email confirmation after successful payment.

articles.title: Managing your subscription
articles.content: Manage your subscription in Profile > Subscription. To upgrade or cancel, use the Manage Subscription controls or contact support. Cancellations take effect at the end of the billing cycle unless noted otherwise.

articles.title: Subscription expiration
articles.content: You'll receive reminders before expiration depending on your account settings. After expiration, your account may revert to a lower tier; your historical data is typically preserved. Contact support for account-specific questions.

articles.title: Login issues
articles.content: Can't log in: verify email/password, clear cache, try incognito, or reset your password. If issues persist, contact support with your registered email and a description of the problem.

articles.title: Test not loading
articles.content: If a test won't load: check internet, refresh (Ctrl+F5), try another browser, or disable extensions. If the passage is temporarily unavailable, try another one or contact support.

articles.title: Attempt summary not showing
articles.content: If an attempt summary is missing after submission: wait a minute and refresh, check the Attempts page directly, and ensure you completed submission. If still missing, contact support with attempt date/time.

articles.title: Analytics seeming stale
articles.content: Analytics update in near real-time after tests. If data looks stale: refresh, log out/in, or clear cache. If problems persist, contact support.

articles.title: Password reset
articles.content: Click Forgot Password on the login page and enter your registered email. You should receive a reset link by email usually within a few minutes; if not, check spam or contact support.

articles.title: How many tests can I take per day?
articles.content: Access depends on your plan. The platform provides daily RC allocations (for example, 2 RCs/day); specific availability and any additional access for certain plans are described on the Subscriptions page.

articles.title: Can I retake the same passage?
articles.content: Yes — retakes are recorded separately in Attempts. Use retakes to practice speed or strategies on difficult passages.

articles.title: How is the leaderboard calculated?
articles.content: Leaderboards use a combination of accuracy and time. Exact ranking rules may vary; see leaderboard documentation for details.

articles.title: What is Daily Streak?
articles.content: Daily Streak tracks consecutive days with at least one completed test. Keep practicing daily to maintain it; longest streak is saved to your profile.

articles.title: How do I contact support?
articles.content: Email us at {{supportEmail}} or use the feedback form (Dashboard > Daily Feedback). We typically respond {{responseTime}}. Include your registered email and a detailed description.

articles.title: Is my data private and secure?
articles.content: We use industry-standard protections for data transmission and storage. Read the Privacy Policy for details and contact support for data requests or deletion.
